projects.name: Raytracer
projects.text: A raytracer written completely in C++ I made for a university assignment. It's not the most advanced, but I am proud of it (and the fact the entire thing was made in 9 days), Unfortunately, the university bars me from putting the source code online.

projects.name: Comedy TUI
projects.text: This is an app I built for my work in comedy shows. It's a really simple terminal UI that has a stopwatch, room for notes, and manages the music currently playing. It enables me to focus on the important parts of the job, which is great.

projects.name: Mandelbrot
projects.text: A Mandelbrot renderer I made for a university course written in C#. It is multithreaded, has multiple color modes, and the ability to export and import renders as .mandel files, which is a file format specially created for this project. Unfortunately, the university bars me from putting the source code online.

projects.name: AulaControl
projects.text: This project aimed to control the auditorium at my old high school using a USB to DMX converter written in Kotlin. It played music and controlled the lights during lunchtime.

projects.name: Advent Of Code
projects.text: All of my current Advent of Code solutions, written in Kotlin. Some of the worst code I've written, yet I've learnt a ton from it.

projects.name: NixOS Config
projects.text: The configurations for my NixOS machines. It includes configuration for all my apps, window managers, network, timezones, and more. It's also modularized so that adding a new machine with unique property is a breeze.
